docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The Local Actor API is a REST-based JSON API for provisioning AMQP 1.0 connections to send (deliveries) or receive (subscriptions) data. The API supports high-availability use cases with horizontal scaling and automated failover.

docs.title: Connection Management
docs.text:
Clients must poll their deliveries/subscriptions after creation. Otherwise, the resources may be deprovisioned.

Changes detected via polling:

  • Status updates
  • Endpoint changes

docs.title: Code Examples
docs.text: Example Description Link Subscription (Python) Simple subscription client GitHub Delivery (Python) Simple delivery client GitHub

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: The following OpenAPI 3.0.3 specification can be downloaded here

docs.title: POST /{actorCommonName}/subscriptions
docs.text:
Input parameters

Parameter In Type Default Nullable Description actorCommonName path string No

Request body

application/json 

{
    "selector": "string"
}
⚠️ This example has been generated automatically from the schema and it is not accurate. Refer to the schema for more information.

Schema of the request body 
{
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "selector": {
            "type": "string"
        }
    },
    "title": "SubscriptionRequest"
}

Response 200 OK

application/json 

{
    "id": "string",
    "selector": "string",
    "status": "REQUESTED",
    "endpoints": [
        {
            "host": "string",
            "port": 0,
            "source": "string",
            "maxBandwidth": 0,
            "maxMessageRate": 0
        }
    ],
    "lastUpdatedTimestamp": 0
}
⚠️ This example has been generated automatically from the schema and it is not accurate. Refer to the schema for more information.

Schema of the response body 
{
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "id": {
            "type": "string"
        },
        "selector": {
            "type": "string"
        },
        "status": {
            "type": "string",
            "enum": [
                "REQUESTED",
                "CREATED",
                "ILLEGAL",
                "NOT_VALID",
                "NO_OVERLAP",
                "RESUBSCRIBE"

            "items": {

        }

    "title": "Subscription"
}

docs.title: Capability
docs.text: Name Type application Properties: messageType, protocolVersion, publisherId, publicationId, originatingCountry, quadTree metadata Properties: shardCount, infoURL, redirectPolicy, maxBandwidth, maxMessageRate, repetitionInterval

docs.title: CertificateSignRequest
docs.text: Name Type csr string

docs.title: CertificateSignResponse
docs.text: Name Type certificates Array<string>

docs.title: Delivery
docs.text: Name Type endpoints Array<DeliveryEndpoint> id string lastUpdatedTimestamp integer selector string status string

docs.title: DeliveryEndpoint
docs.text: Name Type host string maxBandwidth integer maxMessageRate integer port integer selector string target string

docs.title: DeliveryRequest
docs.text: Name Type selector string

docs.title: OnboardingCapability
docs.text: Type:

docs.title: Subscription
docs.text: Name Type endpoints Array<SubscriptionEndpoint> id string lastUpdatedTimestamp integer selector string status string

docs.title: SubscriptionEndpoint
docs.text: Name Type host string maxBandwidth integer maxMessageRate integer port integer source string

docs.title: SubscriptionRequest
docs.text: Name Type selector string

docs.title: Security
docs.text:
• Uses TLS v1.3 with Client Certificate Authentication
  • The certificate's Common Name (CN) is used as client identity (clientCommonName)
  • SASL-EXTERNAL must be used for AMQP authentication

docs.title: Usage Policy
docs.text:
• GET/DELETE: max 1 request per 5 seconds per path
  • POST: max 1 request per 30 seconds per path

Violating these policies may result in access revocation.

docs.title: Create subscription
docs.text:
POST /{clientCommonName}/subscriptions

Create a new subscription. 

{
  "selector": "<JMS selector>"
}

  • Empty selector: subscribe to all data
  • Example: messageType = 'SPATEM' AND publisherId = 'NL12345'

Response: 

{
  "id": "<subscriptionId>",
  "status": "CREATED",
  "endpoints": [
    {
      "host": "amqp.example.net",
      "port": 5671,
      "source": "/some/source",
      "maxBandwidth": 10000,
      "maxMessageRate": 50
    }
  ],
  "lastUpdatedTimestamp": 1713800000000
}

docs.title: Get all subscriptions
docs.text:
GET /{clientCommonName}/subscriptions

List all subscriptions.

docs.title: Poll subscription
docs.text:
GET /{clientCommonName}/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}

Retrieve details of a specific subscription (for polling).

docs.title: Delete subscription
docs.text:
DELETE /{clientCommonName}/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}

Delete a subscription. Returns HTTP 204.

docs.title: Create delivery
docs.text:
POST /{clientCommonName}/deliveries

Create a new delivery. 

{
  "selector": "<JMS selector>"
}

Response: 

{
  "id": "<deliveryId>",
  "status": "CREATED",
  "endpoints": [
    {
      "host": "amqp.example.net",
      "port": 5671,
      "target": "/some/target",
      "maxBandwidth": 5000,
      "maxMessageRate": 20
    }
  ],
  "lastUpdatedTimestamp": 1713800000000
}

docs.title: Get all deliveries
docs.text:
GET /{clientCommonName}/deliveries

List all deliveries.

docs.title: Poll delivery
docs.text:
GET /{clientCommonName}/deliveries/{deliveryId}

Retrieve details of a specific delivery (for polling).

docs.title: Delete delivery
docs.text:
DELETE /{clientCommonName}/deliveries/{deliveryId}

Delete a delivery. Returns HTTP 204.
